9: The increased use of electric vehicles (EVs) is expected to significantly reduce pollution and decrease our reliance on fossil fuels.
(1) Electric vehicles will have minimal impact on pollution, as their production still relies heavily on fossil fuels.
(2) The widespread adoption of electric vehicles is expected to reduce pollution and dependence on fossil fuels.
(3) Electric vehicles have no effect on reducing pollution, as their environmental benefits are offset by the energy used to produce them.
(4) Electric vehicles are only effective at reducing pollution when combined with other renewable energy solutions.
10: Recent advancements in artificial intelligence have raised ethical concerns about privacy, decision-making, and the potential for bias in automated systems.
(1) Ethical concerns about AI primarily focus on privacy, with little attention to the impact on decision-making processes.
(2) Most ethical concerns surrounding AI are related to its potential to replace human workers, rather than its effects on privacy or bias.
(3) Ethical concerns about AI are overstated, as the technology has proven to be impartial and unbiased in all applications.
(4) While AI presents numerous benefits, it also introduces significant ethical concerns, particularly regarding privacy and bias.
11: The rise of global trade has helped reduce poverty in many developing countries, but it has also led to environmental degradation and exploitation of labor.
(1) Global trade has mainly benefited the environment, with little effect on poverty reduction in developing countries.
(2) The negative effects of global trade, such as environmental damage, outweigh the benefits of poverty reduction in developing countries.
(3) While global trade has contributed to poverty reduction in some regions, it has also resulted in environmental harm and labor exploitation.
(4) Global trade has had no significant impact on poverty or environmental issues, with its primary focus on economic growth.
12: The ongoing debate about climate change centers on the balance between economic growth and the urgent need to implement sustainable environmental policies.
(1) Climate change discussions are solely focused on economic growth, with little attention paid to the environment or sustainability.
(2) The climate change debate involves reconciling economic growth with the implementation of policies that prioritize environmental sustainability.
(3) Environmental policies take precedence in the climate change debate, with little regard for the economic costs of implementing these policies.
(4) Economic growth and environmental policies are seen as mutually exclusive, with no middle ground between the two.
